questions.question: 1. Which of the following wavelength ranges is associated with UV spectroscopy?

explanations.b: this is the near IR region and not used in UV spectroscopy
explanations.c: This is the UV-Visible range. UV Spectroscopy uses this range of radiations.
explanations.d: this is the X-ray range of radiation

questions.question: 2. In infrared spectroscopy which frequency range is known as the fingerprint region?

explanations.a: this is the fingerprint region of IR spectroscopy where a large number of peaks are obtained and it is difficult to identify them
explanations.b: this is the IR range for C=C, C=O and C=N.
explanations.c: this is the IR range for C triple bonded to C and N.
explanations.d: this is the IR range for single bonds involving H.
